page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF MOTHERWELL
page.content: The Block covers part of Motherwell District, which is situated in the Clyde Valley within the Central Industrial Belt of Scotland. The housing is mainly Council Estates but Private Housing Developments are increasing. There is a high proportion of houses built as flats and tower blocks of up to sixteen storeys high. The Council has made good use of space by landscaping. They are currently running an{Anti-litter {Campaign}to improve the environment for the residents and to help attract business and industry. The main industries are steel works and a large engineering works. Despite this, Unemployment is high and many parts of the area suffer{Urban Deprivation. A major feature of the area is the {Strathclyde Country Park}which provides many recreational facilities.
